website_summaries.verdict: The best choice if you're looking for top-notch shears and cutting tools. Otherwise, other models on our list are more versatile.
pros: Incredibly sharp cutting power with Leatherman's heavy-duty construction
Features 6 professional-level tools, including 3 cutting tools
cons: A bit bulky and difficult to remove from the holster
It's pricey, and it lacks the various tools of other Leatherman tools

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED IN LEATHERMAN. DO NOT BUY.  D-
customer_reviews.text: i used to love leatherman they had great quality items, in teh years they started to go down hill and culminated with this good looking piece of trash it is engineered almost perfect, then whoever picked the metals cheaped out, and like so many pictures you have seen they rust almost immediately and the ring cutter snaps off if your cutting anything than the skinny 24K gold. For around 70$ this thing should bemade of titanium, and maybe a better system for it to stay in the sheath. I had mine fall out multiple times when i was running around with it doing drills. both open and closed in the sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!
customer_reviews.text: I work at one of the busiest trauma centers in the country... the trauma team is always asking if I have my "AWESOME shears" when we need to cut through heavy jeans, belts, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dukegirl

customer_reviews.title: 10 days old and rusting
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even used them yet and already surface rust. This is my first pair of these so I'm not sure if this is normal or jot
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: These are the best of the best trauma shear/multi tools out there
customer_reviews.text: These are the best of the best trauma shear/multi tools out there. I have 2 pairs myself (all black, and all blue pair). I purchased these for a friend who was just hired on Boston EMS. The orange is a perfect match to BEMS orange on their trucks so I'm sure he'll love these. Don't hesitate to buy these. Leatherman has a program where you get a sizable discount if you provide your fire/EMS credentials. They don't have colors, just the black shears. Check that out before purchasing for full price.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Cunniff

customer_reviews.title: They broke withing minutes of opening them.
customer_reviews.text: I am a HUGE Leatherman products fan, but this particular item failed within minutes of opening it up. The scissors crossed and became stuck in a position that made it impossible to fold back into the smallest position in order for it to slide into the sheath. The design should be investigated and corrected by Leatherman's quality control team. Hopefully they will correct it with an updated version in the near future, but for now I would 100% not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: This product has a design flaw and may arrive broken or break when needed.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Arrived broken. Common problem from web reviews. Wont open bc one of the handles is permanently locked closed. This can be the case when u get it or sometime later so ull be dealing w warranty issues, which apparently leads to getting another one that will arrive broken or break. Do ur homework and dont spend $75 on a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Rust and stiffen
customer_reviews.text: These scissors were amazing for the first week I had them.... Then rust spots began to show up, and then they got so stiff it was hard to open them to cut things. I cannot believe I spent $75 on these darn things! Maybe they just aren't ideal for emergency room settings.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not with $70 but works
customer_reviews.text: I am a medical provider and I purchased this product from the recommendations of my seniors. It works without issue as a pair of trauma shears and I do like that it is foldable. However, I have two issues with these shears that prevent myself from giving it a 5 star review. They rust very quickly, in fact in just 6 months I’ve had to get them replaced since sani-cloths damage them quickly. The second issue is the holster, which if loosened as the instruction says will lead to them quickly falling apart. To be honest my $12 shears were comparable to these in many ways and I don’t think $70 is reasonable for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Good idea poor design I want to like them but it's not going to happen . The offset handle and the locking mechanism just isn't working for me and I don't know that it ever will , very uncomfortable to carry with the pocket clip add that up with the offset handles and the poor locking mechanism it was a waste of $70 it was a waste of 70 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Jim Glass

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed!! After two days of use on the job, there are already rust stains on the blades. When I called the company to inquire about cleaning it, or replacement, I was told to try WD-40 but that’s a common occurrence!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest damn pair of shears you will find.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish Leatherman would come out with an electricians shear. These things are so damn great. I have a pair in every first aid kit I own. Sounds expensive until you need something like this and it isn't there. Anyway, the shear blades are super sharp and precise. These fold up super compact, even come with a reasonable sheath. I tend not to use the sheath, but if you are an EMT/EMS personnel the sheath might be a useful thing. So if you are looking at this, just buy the damn thing.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So first impression was that these were very nice trauma scissors. I’m an ER/Trauma nurse and I needed something that was going to last me a long time. I used them for my 5 shifts this week and just from that they have began to rust. The holster is loose and will not tighten with a screwdriver or anything I try. They were not worth the money that I payed for them and it was honestly a waste. Hopefully I can get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Cool. Also
customer_reviews.text: Cool. Also, kind of GINORMOUS. I feel like if I have to cut through a carbon fiber seatbelt, or break the window glass on the Air Force One, these puppies would do the job. Did I say they were huge? Also takes a minute to figure out how to refold them, but if you're using them during an emergency, that's probably not the priority, AMIRITE?
customer_reviews.author: C. Cappel

customer_reviews.title: Go direct if you want warranty coverage
customer_reviews.text: When I finally broke down and got a pair they lasted a half a day. The screw came out of the holster and I lost everything but the belt clip. I tried emailing the seller but they wouldnt do anything. So I contacted Leatherman direct all they would do because i didnt buy direct was sell me a new pair at half price.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Coe

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!!!! They lost there sharpness working a few weeks. It won’t even cut through anything anymore without hurting my hand. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Hyped up. Good materials, bad design.
customer_reviews.text: The product I bought is already broken. The locking mechanism to open and close the shear gets stuck and you won’t be able to open the shear unless you force it as the spring is underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Remington C.

customer_reviews.title: but I love these. Most of my coworkers use raptor shears ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the tan ones because they were cheaper than black, but I love these. Most of my coworkers use raptor shears too, and I'm glad I finally got some. I haven't had a chance to try out the ring cutter yet, but the scissors so far have cut through hoodies, snowboarding jackets/pants, backpacks, jeans, and cowboy boots. It takes a day or two to loosen up the spring folding function (nothing a few hours of fiddling with them won't fix), but I love them! This color looks more classy/professional than I expected, and the belt clip hasn't let me down yet. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kk

customer_reviews.title: Controlled cuts where knives can’t.
customer_reviews.text: So this is my first leathernan product and I have to admit, they look and feel very well made. The pivot points are tight with no play and when the locks engage there’s a crisp little click. The thickness of the steel is not too thick and definitely not too thin. Cutting paper, cloth, and even trimming lemons from my tree is a breeze. I’m not a paramedic , but I got these raptors because I sometimes need controlled cuts that my edc pocket knife just can’t perform. These raptors are quickly becoming a part of my personal every day carry. I also liked the huge selection of color options.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael R.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am a transport respiratory therapist and have used this for a year and I have to say I’m disappointed. I excepted better quality from leatherman. The holster broke in 6 months, the sheers are hard to close as the buttons are hard to push. Overall, for the price that you pay, it isn’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sheath bolt/rivet broke in under two weeks
customer_reviews.text: The sheath should make the shears available to be used at all times. Now the sheath is broken and I have to put the product away, which is not why I purchased this item. Don't buy this unless they include a leather or durable cloth/plastic sheath. The fact that the sheath broke at a single rivet means that they didn't engineer the product well enough. Update: I found the other piece it's a weird screw not a rivet. Upgrading to 4 stars since they didn't use blue loctite to keep the screw from unthreading.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi

customer_reviews.title: Had these for a long while now
customer_reviews.text: Love them. I am a paramedic and uses these every shift! They stay sharp, feel strong in your hand, and don’t fall out of the holster. They fit in the holster when they are unfolded, so you don’t have to waste time or possibly rip your gloves putting them away, and it’s a good way to remember to clean them after a call. They should come in more colors, but I’m very happy with my raptors. They will cut though several layers of clothing, thick coats, even leather boots/jackets like they are paper. I’ve not tried cutting a penny with them, I hear you can, but that’s stupid, take care of them so they can last.
customer_reviews.author: Brad R

customer_reviews.title: The shears you want in your bag when lives and limbs are on the line
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced? Perhaps. Shears are one of the most important and most-used tools in a real first-aid kit. If you want to be prepared for disaster and emergency, you are not going to find better shears. This will quickly cut off denim to reveal the compound fracture beneath, or cut through a seat belt to rescue someone trapped. It folds small, and doesn't require you to know how to sharpen scissors to keep it sharp. If only I could keep my kids from "borrowing" it. Made in Oregon, I believe.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great company, great products.
customer_reviews.text: Leatherman has treated me perfect with great products. This is no exception. It arrived in excellent condition and on time. I ordered the molle attachment pouch and it now resides on the outside of my go bag. This item folds up into a small footprint without any loss on structural strength. The attachments are a perfect fit and all blades are SHARP! I have been using Leatherman products for over 20 years in a public safety career and have, unfortunately, pushed some of the products past the breaking point. Leatherman has a no hassle garantee and the items were immediately replaced. Great company, great products.
customer_reviews.author: Lt Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great shears - epecially for travel
customer_reviews.text: Took them while traveling to distant locations. The big advantage is they fold to a smaller, more compact package. I was also concerned about premature dulling, they stayed sharp. Will cut thin material easily & accurately. Also were tighter than I expected when folded out. Very good shears if you can manage the price. If not, there's another source of (non-folding) EMT shears coated with titanium that are outstanding. The name rhymes with Strauss, they're sold on Amazon, too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Davis

customer_reviews.title: Every Er nurse and medic should have a pair
customer_reviews.text: If you work in an ER or deal with any trauma situations, do yourself a favor and just buy them. Cut through anything, zippers, rings (not real tungsten), fish hooks etc. just keep a close eye on them, they grow legs and run away. Only down side is after a while the can be difficult to clean between all the nooks. I just scrubbed mine with detergent and a toothbrush then threw them in the dishwasher, works like a poor mans autoclave
customer_reviews.author: TREAUX

customer_reviews.title: these wont break, very well made keep full size, or fold up like magic.
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty scissors, for my emergency disaster go bag, very strong, folds up like magic. It has several small tools on it. very cool, utility tool scissors. scissors can be stored in pouch in folded up format, or fully open format, very neat. perfect for big hands as well.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Loved til they rusted
customer_reviews.text: Really loved these..... Haven’t had them even 3 Months went to open and use yesterday and saw them rusted. Sucks I haven’t even used them a hand full of times.... Super bummed :( Never got them wet may I add Update: I contacted Leatherman directly regarding their 25 year warranty and this happens to be not coverable.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Defective product?
customer_reviews.text: I am kind of disappointed with this product. I was very excited about it and showed it off at work when it first arrived. However, in less than 3 weeks, I am seeing rusting on the blades. I keep them clean and dry after every use, so I don't understand what happened. Also, the blades seem to get stuck when opening them from the collapsed position. I have to close them a few times for them to open properly. Doesn't always happen, but it makes traumas run less smoothly. Perhaps I got a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: While the Raptor may be more expensive than other trauma shears that sometimes are given away, what you’re paying for is quality that will last. The Raptor may be the last pair of shears you’ll ever need. I’m a FF/EMT and I’ve been using them for several years, and they’ve never let me down. Some folks don’t like how you have to unfold them to use them...just leave ready to go in the pocket on your bag or pants...you don’t have to fold them up after every use and put them back in the holster! Although, I find the process of unfolding them pretty simple to accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: Telly

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth The Cost
customer_reviews.text: I was taken by these shears while doing a rotation in the ED. Nearly every emergency department nurse had a set, and they all swore by them. I had seen them prior and had blown them off due to the price. If you work in the medical field (nurse, EMT, Paramedic, etc) they are well worth the cost. While there are a few features I will likely not use, like the O2 tank wrench, I would not trade them for any other shears. I didn't think I would use the seat belt cutter either, but I have discovered that it cuts through fabric, even denim and leather fast and easily.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Great for Nurses
customer_reviews.text: Bought this same shear twice, its a very good first responder scissor. But I work as a nurse and use it often, only problem was that its difficult to cut nice holes for colostomy bags because of the sized so I still also carry a small shear as well. But this scissor is excellent for cutting wound vac foams. I like that it fold and I can keep it in my scrubs folded for safety.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Versatile multifunctional compact scissors
customer_reviews.text: I’m a physician and always carry Trauma shears in case of need. This is for my personal use, and the compact folding size is great for discrete carry. My every day carry bag is Molle compatible so the holster fits securely. This has a convenient glass break, a metric ruler, ring cutter, seat belt cutter and oxygen tank wrench. The scissors fold by depressing triangular buttons. There is a clip that allows pocket carry or secure hold in the included holster. The scissors have a smooth action and are stable for use against cloth, coins or thin lightweight metals. Overall I have been pleased with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle VisionTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how much more comfortably these sit in my pocket (because they fold over) - plus they don't poke through your pocket. Other than that, they are what you expect from a very expensive pair of shears: great quality, sturdy, sharp ---- I won't retire for another 10 years and I've no doubt that these will still function just like when they were new. Amazon's price is on par with what you will find elsewhere. One of those few buys that you just "Must Have!" that actually lived up to the hype.
customer_reviews.author: icu NURSE

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman, why say more.
customer_reviews.text: It’s Leatherman, enough said. I have used leatherman tools since the early 90s. Always solid and great quality tools. When I have lost tools, I simply run out and purchased a replacement model immediately. Bought this Raptor for my home medical kit. Love the fit and feel, ease of use and quality. Also multi purpose, better than simple dedicated shears. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Compact, yet extremely versatile
customer_reviews.text: Great product, however I am having a serious issue with the holster. I keep it on my duty belt and I have the screws come undone during two traffic stops which is extremely frustrating. The raptor tool itself is a great asset to my personal toolbox as a cop. To have four tools in one small holster on my belt, (when it stays on), is awesome! I have even ordered my coworker one.
customer_reviews.author: John Dekoning

customer_reviews.title: These are the best trauma shears on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are the best trauma shears on the market, bar none. The only weak point is the ring cutter. I have cut through titanium rings with them, but I have also had the ring cutter break on me with 2 different pairs. Fortunately, Leatherman has a warranty, but still, it would be nice if they didn't break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re an EMS professional, these are a must have. I’ve heard the gripes about them rusting, but after a season on the line on a hotshot crew, they’re holding up as well as could be imagined. They’ve been used to cut a leather boot from a pt, they cut through zippers, nomex and anything else. One night cutting line, we ran into a steel wire fence. The ring cutters worked perfectly to cut the wire, and we were on our way. Again, if you’re an EMS pro, they’re a must have. Extremely versatile, durable and worth every penny. If you want to be the stick in the mud who thinks standard shears are better, your loss.
customer_reviews.author: Hotshot Hank

customer_reviews.title: A high quality and versatile emergency tool
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quality pair of emergency shears and this pair fit the bill better than the cheap stamped steel versions. This pair has additional tools that emergency shears don't have like; O2 tank wrench, strap cutter, glass breaker, ruler and fold in half to fit into a compact holster.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Utah

customer_reviews.title: These shears are great when they function correctly
customer_reviews.text: These shears are great when they function correctly, and I highly recommend them. I am an ER nurse and use these to snip clothes, jewelry, and wires off of people quite hastily. Mine now has trouble opening, and get's caught in a weird area. I have colleagues with the same shears and they don't have the same problems. I've compared our sheers to determine the problem, but no obvious answer. Leatherman has a great 25 year warranty, I just have to ship them in for repair. I want to love these, and I hope to resolve the problems that I have with them!
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and very cool.
customer_reviews.text: When you get down to it these are probably a little overpriced for what they do, but they are still pretty darn cool and sharp as hell. I like how they can be stored in the holster folded up or deployed. Only complaint I would have is that they do end up with some surface rust. Seen others here make that complaint as well. No idea how this is happening as they are advertised as being stainless steel and mine are always kept clean and dry. Contemplating keeping them covered in a light coating of vegetable oil or something to keep it from spreading?
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kaffar

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and durable did not work for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pair of utility scissors. I was happily surprised that it didn't come with the sheath. Sadly I did return them they were a little bit more expensive than what I needed them for. I was going to use them for fishing but I have second thoughts after I receive them. I took a look at what all was on them and determined that it would not work for what I needed it
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again..
customer_reviews.text: Already rusting after 3 months, leatherman will not replace. Great for thick fabric like jeans and leather, horrible for bandages and thin fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. First thing I did was cut a penny. They are much larger than your typical shears but I already knew that. The carrying case is convenient because they are heavy. Overall, these are amazing and a great addition to any medical career... could even come in handy for your general handyman or just someone who wants a nifty tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality.
customer_reviews.text: High quality. I like these scissors very much. I work in an active ER, they cut most anything I can fit into them. There are some things that no trauma shears should cut number one cowboy girl or cowboy belts number two boots. Don't ever cut those two things off somebody and you should be in good shape.I do wish that you were able to autoclave them.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Northrop

customer_reviews.title: You need one for each car.
customer_reviews.text: All in all a good product. Because we live in a flood prone city, there is good reason to have a means to escape a car when its electrical system fails. That means potentially having to break a window. And what if you can't reach your seatbelt release? Being able to cut the seatbelt could be a lifesaver. Having a well deigned set of shears in your car is a plus, too. Finding a place to always have it handy in you car could be a challege. That's why the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Checkmate46

customer_reviews.title: Rust spots within weeks
customer_reviews.text: Love these scissors for the sturdiness and feel. Dislike that like many other reviews, they do have rust spots after only a few weeks of use and cleaning with medical equipment sanitizing wipes. I’m sure the spots would come off with a gun bore cleaning solution or something of the like but still, for the cost this is an inconvenience
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome trauma shears
customer_reviews.text: I brought these to class and all the instructors immediately gathered around and wanted to play with them. They zip through clothing and cut right through shoes, boots, hockey skates, pennies and everything else that fits between the blades. I find the built in clip more useful than the sheath, and they stay snugly attached to my pocket lip with the clip. You can open them with one hand with a little practice. I haven't tried the glass breaker, but I'm sure it works fine. I can't really think of any way to improve them.
customer_reviews.author: Galka

customer_reviews.title: Great Shears for any emergency use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I work hospital security and just having a multi tool doesn’t cut it (literally). These are great for all my needs and the case can take a beating. The only reason I couldn’t give this product five starts is that I have a hard time keeping the case secured to my 2.5 in duty belt. If only the Molle case had just a little longer clip. Otherwise these are great.
customer_reviews.author: ScottBecki

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Sturdy, Multi-Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my Emergency Room Nurse wife, and she uses them every day. She reports that they are sharp, sturdy, and do the job well. The extra features and cutting power have come in handy a few times for her already, and she's only had them a couple months. A few of her pals are now proud owners of these great shears due to her "demo" of them.
customer_reviews.author: Walorado

customer_reviews.title: Look and be SHARP
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my little brother who's in his residency bec he's about to become a doctor. He's told me everyday for a week how much he loves these and everyone who sees them is wicked jelly. He said they make him look and feel like a pro and the senior docs were taken back by how prepared he was. Well played young padawan!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Really Good product
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time on a full arrest, and was able to cut throught the clothing with ease. They come extremely sharp and the oxygen turn on feature has been more helpful in itself than the main function of the scissors. Would highly recommend, not just for first responders but those in construction and other physically enducing work.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kate

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a must have for FF's/EMT's/Paramedics/First Responders
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal product again by Leatherman. The trauma shears are extremely well built and sturdy like you expect from this company. The blade edge on the shears is very sharp and does not dull easily. They've been in service now for a couple months, used extensively daily, and are holding up great! Definitely a great product
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: If have choices give me what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shears but I wanted and ordered the Molle pack instead fit this awful plastic holder. I need a way to get what I paid for. And for being great shears I could really use I can’t with the way it came. Also for the cost I should get what is wanted. A change in review once this issue is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Judy maddox

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy to manipulate with one hand. Effective.
customer_reviews.text: Received these yesterday, went on shift at 1900... Raptors helped this weekend with a trauma assessment in Sedan VS Motorcyclist, trauma alert. Cardiac arrest, cleared up the clothing in the way? Nope! Also assisted in a few other incidents both in the street and emergency room assisting.... Tool may have jinxed the weekend, but they definitely were appreciated! Will continue to replace this if they ever break.... definitely worth the $70!!!
customer_reviews.author: SJK

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.text: So I work in an Emergency Department as a tech. I always need shears and have ended up with a collection of trauma shears at home of the ones from work (currently gathering them ALL to return current count is 20). Anyways I had been debating about getting these for so long because they collapse and fit great in my cargo pockets. Super sturdy, easy to use and always sharp. Also the warranty is amazing! I had a coworker break the ring cutter and Leatherman replaced his shears. BEST BUY EVER!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Cole

customer_reviews.title: Somebody got something right with these !!
customer_reviews.text: They are pricey but are a good pair of trauma sheers. I was working a code & borrowed a pair of the medic that was on the ambulance & was amazed at how heat they cut. No hesitations and in have the time had it normally takes & was on to doing other things. Been working EMS Field over 30 years & haven’t seen any better. I hate spending my hard earned money on equipment but these are worth it. Super fast shipping had them at my house in 24hrs using regular shipping too
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rusted Without Use
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these are great shears. They're very well built, strong, will cut just about anything, and are easy to use. My only complain is rust. I've seen several other reviews talking about how they started rusting after some use and no proper maintenance. However, mine started rusting after only 4 days with no use whatsoever, and never having gotten wet. The Raptor is a very well constructed tool, it's just unfortunate that it started rusting so ludicrously fast.
customer_reviews.author: Todd P.

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of Trauma Shears I own!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Leatherman sure hit one outta the park on this one! I love how it folds up for storage! And I love the built in ring cutter, seatbelt cutter, etc! I would absolutely purchase again! Best set of trauma shears ive ever purchased! They sit in the kydex holster that came with them attatched to my Mymedic Recon bag!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Works good but i think i got a defective pair
customer_reviews.text: It works great. I've cut through 3 layers of clothing at a time with ease with these shears. my only complaint is that when I unfold them from the compact position I need to kinda slam them open for the retracting tab to catch to lock the shears open. Other than that they work great, I just wish my pair would of worked as it should. Maybe needs better quality control?
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I work in the Emergency Room and these Sheers are perfect for cutting off patients clothing especially in trauma situation. I would definitely recommend this product for anyone working as an EMT or Emergency Room Personnel. The engraving with name makes it easy to let everyone know whose sheers these are.
customer_reviews.author: Wainwright Greenidge

customer_reviews.title: ER Nurse Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I work in the ER and love these shears so much. Effortless cut through thick material like jeans, ace bandages and layers of shirts. A must have if you work in a trauma setting! I bought the orange and black because everyone has the black and I wanted mine to stand out. Scissors fold up to an easy to carry size. I do not use the clip but rather put them in the pocket of my scrub pants and they are not too heavy or bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Jacobsen Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rust Easy
customer_reviews.text: Good pair of trauma scissors, have had theres for almost 2 months and they are already have rust spots. Very poor quality scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I'm an ED Nurse and these are fantastic. 25 yr warranty and well-made
customer_reviews.text: I'm an ED Nurse and these are fantastic. 25 yr warranty and well-made. Came with a sheath too that I don't use. I've ripped motorcycle leathers with the trauma hook, cut plenty of fiberglass delta-splint without dulling, and the ring cutter is excellent (fast and easy). The only drawback is cleaning; which can take some time if saturated with body substances. I soak mine in peroxide, then use bleach wipes. So good I put a second pair in my BOB.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, bad sheath.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. The only reason for 3 stars is because of the junk sheath. Im not sure why leatherman pairs great tools with possibly the worst sheaths ever made. But the tool fits great in a condor single pistol mag pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had my last pair for 4 years and the only reason I had to buy another was because someone stole them. I work in the ER and I used my shears for cutting trauma clothes off, opening oxygen tanks, cutting rings and so much more. Best shears I have had, most of the staff have them. I got the orange handle this time since nobody has that and will be easily identified if someone sees them.
customer_reviews.author: Jolyn

customer_reviews.title: Over priced and over rated
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on sale and they are great but I honestly like using my $12 madison supply scissors better than my raptors. I work in a level 2 trauma ER and use them on a daily basis. ( I carry both my raptors and madison supply scissors) Raptors are difficult to clean after they get bloody and blood seems to get stuck in all the little cracks and you can not get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Roach

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through it all
customer_reviews.text: These can really cut through most anything pretty easily. I've used them on the ambulance and in the emergency room. I like the multiple tools, and I like that I can fold them up. My one issue that I've had and many other of my friends with them, is that they can rust. If you work on a truck, or even just with regular wiping down of sani-wipes, some of those smaller spaces seem to get rust spots. For something so durable in all other aspects, it seems weird it rusts so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Munch

customer_reviews.title: My hubby LOVES these!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my hubby as a surprise after a family friend showed them to me! I was amazed at how well they worked. So I surprised my hubby with them and he LOVES them. He said I didn’t even know that they made this!!! He wears them to work everyday since he got them!
customer_reviews.author: Slave2tattoos

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR FIRST RESPONDERS
customer_reviews.text: As first responder, this tool is must have item. I used mine on several occasions and I love them. Highly recommend for anyone who wants reliable tool and life saver when situation arrises. Great for outdoors and camping I found out that I used mine on many occasions during my vacation.
customer_reviews.author: SJJ

customer_reviews.title: Better than the hype
customer_reviews.text: Leatherman shears: fit great in the hand, clip to my scrubs without issues of any kind. Shears work as they should. I honestly haven't tried the other tools, but they're all there and all deploy positively and seem sturdy. I use them every day, but I may have to get a new job because I think my charge nurse is jealous and might try to steal them...
customer_reviews.author: chris fugere

customer_reviews.title: I bought this hearing good things about the product and had good experience using ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hearing good things about the product and had good experience using my coworker's pair. The lock mechanism keeps jamming on the handle that is used for your fingers (not thumb handle) when in the closed position. I am going to try and send them back but I'm disappointed it was not checked by the manufacturer as they stated they are all hand made.
customer_reviews.author: John McCafferty

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a boss
customer_reviews.text: It cuts through everything I put in front of it. The cuts are clean and precise without much effort. It is just another amazing piece of tool from Leatherman. It’s a great addition to my collections. I currently own Surge, Sidekick, Wave+ and so on..
customer_reviews.author: Tools. Electro. DIY

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Scissors are great! Customer service leaves something to be desired. Parts of the scissors were loose when the box was opened. The security star wrench needed to do the maintenance were not included. After contacting the company they informed me to go buy the necessary tools. Seems like a 10 cent wrench would be easy to include, or send out if it's needed. We will keep them and fix them, but still disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable with the added benefit of being compact and easy to carry in the operating room. Much more capable scissors than the usual type supplied with the added benefit of a ring cutter. Don’t know if I will ever need the window breaking or seatbelt cutting parts but all in all a very high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E Ames

customer_reviews.title: Great First Responder Rescue Medical Tool
customer_reviews.text: Was one fence of whether or not to purchase these or use the cheap one provided by my department. These are beautiful, solid, easy to open and fold. The belt cutter is sharp and requires little effort to use. The holster allows for various methods of carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shears
customer_reviews.text: These shears are reliable, well built, and have served me well. There are two problems though. 1. Rust is an issue that keeps happening to me. I tried the oil thing and keeping them dry but it just happens. They still work every time. 2. They keep getting stolen from me. 😒 Otherwise; great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from Leatherman
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, tough, and highly compact. All your basic emergency medical tools in one convenient device. Would highly recommend to anyone who works in emergency service or to anybody who just likes to be prepared. It's even a great addition to your home first aid kit.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: All in one clinical tool.
customer_reviews.text: I use these everyday at work. I do anesthesia and I can’t say enough about how handy these things are. Especially in traumas. Clips right to my scrubs, don’t need the holster. If they could attach a pen, a stethoscope, and credit card holder to this thing I would never leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: Btheman3

customer_reviews.title: EMS/EMT recommend this tool!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a member of a BSA Explorer post and he regularly serves the community by volunteering his time and skills serving our community as a member of a 3 person ambulance crew. Gold Cross ambulance service trains youth 14 and older the skills necessary to be there and deal with whatever the case may be from that 911 call. Many of the crew member have this exact item and use it daily. He wanted one and we bought it for him as a Christmas Gift. If you have a EMS/EMT member in your family they will love the lifesaving features of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W Troxel

customer_reviews.title: Best trauma shears, hands down. PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: I use these at work in the ED. They cut through everything.....clothes, belts, wire bras, metal, plastic, orthoglass...... it has a ring cutter, seat belt cutter, glass breaker, O2 tank valve key, and a built in ruler on one of the blades. This is my second one....first one's getting replaced under warranty after thr ring cutter broke after a thousand uses.....get it!
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.text: Great buy! I would spend the money again! *Update* I just broke a window, first try and super easy! Worked like an actual window punch. I also used the seatbelt cutter and the shears part and both cut no problem. Definitely worth the price! Also I've used multiple time to cut clothes, I cant say enough good things!
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: Expensive shears, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I work in prehospital ems and regularly cut off thick clothing; jeans, leather jacks, etc. these shears haven’t let me down yet and hopefully they never do. 4 stars because they are super expensive for a pair of shears. however, you won’t find much cheaper anywhere else even on leathermans website. And although they are expensive you pay for the great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jerald

customer_reviews.title: Susceptible to rust
customer_reviews.text: So i work in very humid climate and i have been having to treat the shears and clean constantly otherwise they would rust incredibly fast.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Great Trauma Shears!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my career field in EMS. That cut through clothes very easily and are able to shear a penny in half. We tested it out one day in an EMT-B class I was helping out in. Great trauma shears and I would completely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to have for multipurpose use.
customer_reviews.text: Mine came a little use but these are bad ass. If you work in corrections and your agency allows you to cary these than i would reccomend it. These can cut clothes off of disruptive suicidal inmate these can also cut through ankle monitors for people on probation and metal wires and are useful.
customer_reviews.author: This is my public name

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: They are amazingly sharp. Other medical professionals who borrow them love them, too. The seat belt cutter works great for cutting out the bottom of paper cups to make funnels for ice machine/ice bags. I can't speak to the holder as my Aviator scrubs have velcro pockets for shears and hemostats. I'm sure they'd work great in a self-defense situation if it came to that. Sad that nursing is such a dangerous profession between microbes and violent people. Please vote for policies to protect all medical personnel!
customer_reviews.author: Janet C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: These shears work as advertised they are well built easily stored in the holster or pocket sharp blades cut well however, one downfall is they will develope slight rusting rather quickly I would advise dabbing a little ws 40 on the blades otherwise they are good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Effective
customer_reviews.text: I've had Leatherman tools before, but they have always felt like the designers had added features so they could say "10 tools" instead of "9 tools that make sense together". This tool has none of that. They are easy to use and all of the features make sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: Love that this is compact enough to fit in my scrub pockets and still strong enough to cut throw anything. I do have to become more comfortable with folding it back up but that will come this time. Wish I would have bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In addition to being sweet looking, the sound the holster makes when holstering/unholstering ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a critical care nurse and use these in the hospital setting for rapid responses, codes, etc. as well as use them in every day life. In addition to being sweet looking, the sound the holster makes when holstering/unholstering sounds sweet as well. Everyone asks about them, how much they cost, etc. and they function as they should. The seat belt cutter works well although I haven't had the opportunity to use the window breaker yet. They're a bit pricey, but they're also high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of Shears
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these Shears daily for the last 6 years. The only reason why I am buying another pair is because my first aid kit was stolen out of my car. Very handy tool for those involved in pre-hospital care. All tools work great. However, I have never used the ring cutter function before so I cant vouch for that.
customer_reviews.author: AaronK

customer_reviews.title: Most trusted shears in the field.
customer_reviews.text: As an EMT a good set of shears is important. These are a fantastic choice, and I can guarantee if you ask anyone on the field they'll recommend these as well. Just make sure you let these dry well because they will rust, and the lifetime warranty wont cover it. The ring cutters are prone to breaking after use, but are covered by the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Panzer

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of Shears
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid and well made pair of shears. Much better than most and made by a solid company. Little expensive but you get what you pay for with this. Even comes with a holster that can work on belt or on vest with molle.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja

customer_reviews.title: scissors work best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to primarily use the shears. They work much better than traditional trauma shears. Using the other options is a little cumbersome to open/ close. It's hard to use in the dark so you need to practice opening/closing everything so you can quickly use it effectively when it's dark.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I used the ring cutter to cut through barb wire to get to a trauma scene. But I broke the ring cutter on a hard ring so I ordered another pair. You have to keep them oiled or they will rust but they are the best trauma shears you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Justice Nathan wright

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Medics!
customer_reviews.text: They lived up to the hype the time it actually mattered. Had a bad trauma and broke out the freebie shears like every call before... And ended up throwing them in the stairwell out of frustration from their utter uselessness. Thankfully our back up carried a pair and quickly offered. Threw the old ones away, restocked the bag with a new cheap pair and most importantly my partner and I bought ourselves a pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen W.

customer_reviews.title: Another awesome tool purchase from NETRUSH, delivered by AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product from leatherman . Bit expensive Don’t have lot tool in it . But very good use in medical field . Sharp scissors, seat belt cutter , oxygen cylinder opener , u can do small Measures etc . Very useful for nurses, firefighters, emt people. Don’t forget to purchase from NETRUSH ur true & trusted vendor on AMAZON. Way to go NETRUSH
customer_reviews.author: Aries8421

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my RN
customer_reviews.text: She really wanted these and since she just graduated from nursing school with her RN license I decided I would get them for her. She was extremely happy and said they worked extremely well. Even sent me a picture showing she cut a penny in half.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great shears!
customer_reviews.text: As an ER Nurse in a trauma center, you need good shears. These aren't good shears, these are GREAT! I love how nice they fold and the clip is a great way to keep it on a pocket. I haven't ran into a material these things can't cut! They can cut though anything from jeans, to dirt bike pants, to aluminum splint material. I love all the other features also. Plenty of tools packed into a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Rubicon18250

customer_reviews.title: Leatherman has done it again!
customer_reviews.text: After 25 years in EMS, I have finally found the best trauma shears I have ever owned. Leatherman is a brand name I have trusted for multi tools for years, and they have finally created the ultimate trauma shears with additional tools. The fact that you can store them folded or even unfolded like regular shears. They are sharp, solidly built and will probably be last type of shears I ever purchase for work.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Doug

product_meta.title: LEATHERMAN, Raptor Emergency Response Shears with Strap Cutter and Glass Breaker, Black with Utility Holster
feature_bullets: READY FOR ANYTHING: The Raptor features the necessary tools for medical professionals to handle emergency situations; When it's a question of survival, the Raptor answers loud and clear
INSTANT RESPONSE: Equipped with 6 essential tools, including folding emergency response shears, a strap cutter, a ring cutter, a ruler, an oxygen tank wrench and a carbide glass breaker
SIMPLE, SAFE ACCESS: The specially designed sheath allows you to carry your Raptor open or closed so you're always prepared; Choose between belt-friendly utility or MOLLE-compatible styles

OUR GUARANTEE: We’re proud to stand behind every product that leaves our factory in Portland, Oregon; That’s why we offer our 25-year warranty, so you can be confident your Leatherman lasts a lifetime
ALWAYS ON HAND: No belt on your scrubs? The pocket clip ensures it'll never leave your side; Alternatively, attach your Raptor with the integrated lanyard hole

specifications.Included Components: Leatherman 832168 Raptor Shears with Utility Sheath, Black
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,055 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
